text: California is a state in the Western United States. It is the state with the most people, as 39,538,223 people lived there in 2020. California is split into 58 counties and has 483 municipalities. One county, San Francisco, is a city-county, which means it is both a municipality and county. In California law, there is no difference between a city and town. This means municipalities can use either name.California Government Code Sections 34502 and 56722. The largest municipality by population is Los Angeles, which had 3,898,747 people living there in 2020. The smallest is Amador City, with 200 people living there in 2020. ==Cities and towns== County seat State capital and county seat Name Type County Population (2020) Land area Land area Incorporated
